_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The Dayhoff Elevator, Inc., (formerly Ivan Dayhoff Elevator, Inc.) facility provides its employees with a safe workplace, as well as operating in an environmentally responsible manner.  It is our police to adhere to applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia was to occur, it is our policy to notify the Osage City Fire Department.  

Stationary Source and Regulated Substance Handled

The Dayhoff Elevator, Inc., facility stores and handle anhydrous ammonia for direct retail sale to end users.  The maximum inventory of anhydrous ammonia at the facility is 105,060 pounds stored in two bulk storage vessels (12,000 gallons each).  Anhydrous ammonia is delivered by truck and distributed into smaller tanks for use as a fertilizer.  This facility does not have nurse tanks, so the only anhydrous ammonia storage is the 2 bulk tanks.

General Accidental Release Prevention Program/Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

The Dayhoff Elevator, Inc., facility complies with EPA?s accident prevention rule and applicable state and local codes and regulations.  The facility was designed and installed and is maintained in accordance with applicable local, state, and federal regulations.

Five Year Accident History

The Dayhoff Elevator, Inc., facility has never had an accident involving anhydrous ammonia that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or shelterings in place.

Emergency Response Plan

In the event of an emergency involving the anhydrous ammonia system, it is our policy to notify the Osage City Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.  The facility has discussed this policy with the Osage City Fire Department. 

Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Continued performance of mechanical integrity checks, maintenance checks, compliance audits, and incident investigations will identify changes to improve safety at the faci
lity.  See the Compliance Audit and Hazard Review for updates needed and specific dates that the corrections are planned to be completed.
